title: Trigonometry Practice
solution:
Invert the matrix \( {\begin{bmatrix}\cos &\sin \\-\sin &\cos \\\end{bmatrix}} \)

A general inversion formula for a 2x2 matrix \( A\, \) is:

\( A={\begin{bmatrix}a&b\\c&d\\\end{bmatrix}},\,\,\,A^{{-1}}={\frac {1}{\det(A)}}{\begin{bmatrix}d&-b\\-c&a\\\end{bmatrix}}\, \)

So the inverse for this matrix is:

\( {\begin{bmatrix}\cos &-\sin \\\sin &\cos \\\end{bmatrix}}\, \)

Trigonometry

title: Trigonometry Practice
solution:
Find the amplitude and period of \( 4\sin({\frac {1}{3}}x)\, \)

The amplitude is the coefficient in front of the wave function.

Amplitude = \( 4\, \)

The period is \( 2\pi /b\, \) where \( b\, \) is the coefficient of the argument of the wave function.

Period = \( {\frac {2\pi }{1/3}}=6\pi \, \)

Trigonometry
body: Find the amplitude and period of  \( 4\sin({\frac  {1}{3}}x)\, \)

title: Trigonometry Practice
solution:
If \( \sin(x)={\frac {-4}{5}}\, \) and \( x\, \) is in the third quadrant, find \( \cos(x)\, \) .


Contents
body: If  \( \sin(x)={\frac  {-4}{5}}\, \)  and  \( x\, \)  is in the third quadrant, then find  \( \cos(x)\, \) .

title: Trigonometry Practice
solution:
If a 10 foot tall ladder leans against a wall, and the base of the ladder is 5 feet away from the wall, how far up the wall does the ladder go?

Use Pythagoras' Theorem \( a^{2}+b^{2}=c^{2}\, \) so that \( 5^{2}+b^{2}=10^{2}\, \) .

Then \( b={\sqrt {100-25}}=5{\sqrt {3}}\, \)

Remember that the square root gives a positive and negative answer, but since we're talking about a distance in the real world, use the positive answer.

Trigonometry
body: If a 10 foot tall ladder leans against a wall, and the base of the ladder is 5 feet away from the wall, then how far up the wall does the ladder go?
